Protocols/RVS_BLEDriver_ServiceProtocol..name: serviceID
Protocols/RVS_BLEDriver_ServiceProtocol..abstract: This is the general service ID for the class.

Protocols/RVS_BLEDriverDelegate.html#/s:.name: gtDriver(_:errorEncountered:)
Protocols/RVS_BLEDriverDelegate.html#/s:.abstract: Called when an error is encountered by the main driver.

Protocols/RVS_BLEDriverDelegate.html#/s:.name: gtDriver(_:newDeviceAdded:)
Protocols/RVS_BLEDriverDelegate.html#/s:.abstract: Called when a device has been added and instantiated.

Protocols/RVS_BLEDriverDelegate.html#/s:.name: gtDriverStatusUpdate(_:)
Protocols/RVS_BLEDriverDelegate.html#/s:.abstract: Called to indicate that the driver’s status should be checked.

Protocols/RVS_BLEDriverDelegate.html#/s:.name: gtDriver(_:peripheralDiscovered:)
Protocols/RVS_BLEDriverDelegate.html#/s:.abstract: This is the only place that Core Bluetooth is exposed!

Protocols/RVS_BLEDeviceDelegate.html#/s:.name: gtDevice(_:errorEncountered:)
Protocols/RVS_BLEDeviceDelegate.html#/s:.abstract: Called when an error is encountered by a single device.

Protocols/RVS_BLEDeviceDelegate.html#/s:.name: gtDeviceWillBeRemoved(_:)
Protocols/RVS_BLEDeviceDelegate.html#/s:.abstract: Called when a device is about to be removed.

Protocols/RVS_BLEDeviceDelegate.html#/s:.name: gtDevice(_:wasDisconnected:)
Protocols/RVS_BLEDeviceDelegate.html#/s:.abstract: Called when a device was disconnected for any reason.

Protocols/RVS_BLEDeviceDelegate.html#/s:.name: gtDeviceStatusUpdate(_:)
Protocols/RVS_BLEDeviceDelegate.html#/s:.abstract: Called to indicate that the device’s status should be checked.

Protocols/RVS_BLEDriver_DeviceProtocol.h.name: services
Protocols/RVS_BLEDriver_DeviceProtocol.h.abstract: Required. An Array of protocol instances of the contained services.

Protocols/RVS_SequenceProtocol.html#/s:1.name: isEmpty
Protocols/RVS_SequenceProtocol.html#/s:1.abstract: Returns true, if yes, we have no bananas.

Protocols/RVS_SequenceProtocol.html#/s:1.name: count
Protocols/RVS_SequenceProtocol.html#/s:1.abstract: The number of elements we have. 1-based. 0 is no elements (isEmpty is true).

Protocols/RVS_SequenceProtocol.html.name: RVS_SequenceProtocol
Protocols/RVS_SequenceProtocol.html.abstract: If you conform to this protocol, you get a few basic Sequence attributes for free.

Protocols/RVS_BLEDriver_DeviceProtocol.h.name: RVS_BLEDriver_DeviceProtocol
Protocols/RVS_BLEDriver_DeviceProtocol.h.abstract: This protocol describes a device, or collection of services.

Protocols/RVS_BLEDriverDelegate.html.name: RVS_BLEDriverDelegate
Protocols/RVS_BLEDriverDelegate.html.abstract: A delegate object is required to instantiate an instance of the driver class.

Protocols/RVS_BLEDriver_ServiceProtocol..name: RVS_BLEDriver_ServiceProtocol
Protocols/RVS_BLEDriver_ServiceProtocol..abstract: This protocol describes a service, or collection of values.

Protocols/RVS_BLEDriver_ValueProtocol.ht.name: RVS_BLEDriver_ValueProtocol
Protocols/RVS_BLEDriver_ValueProtocol.ht.abstract: This protocol is used to describe one value in a service.

Extensions/RVS_BLECharacteristic.html#/s.name: rawValue
Extensions/RVS_BLECharacteristic.html#/s.abstract: Returns the value, expressed as raw Data. Nil, if no value available (or not available as Data).

Extensions/RVS_BLECharacteristic.html#/s.name: value
Extensions/RVS_BLECharacteristic.html#/s.abstract: Return a value, dependent upon our type.

Extensions/StringProtocol.html#/s:Sy17RV.name: firstUppercased
Extensions/StringProtocol.html#/s:Sy17RV.abstract: This extension lets us uppercase only the first letter of the string (used for weekdays).

Extensions/StringProtocol.html#/s:Sy17RV.name: urlEncodedString
Extensions/StringProtocol.html#/s:Sy17RV.abstract: The following calculated property comes from this: http://stackoverflow.com/a/27736118/879365

Extensions/StringProtocol.html#/s:Sy17RV.name: index(of:options:)
Extensions/StringProtocol.html#/s:Sy17RV.abstract: This allows us to find the first index of a substring.

Extensions/StringProtocol.html#/s:Sy17RV.name: endIndex(of:options:)
Extensions/StringProtocol.html#/s:Sy17RV.abstract: This allows us to find the last index of a substring.

Extensions/StringProtocol.html#/s:Sy17RV.name: indexes(of:options:)
Extensions/StringProtocol.html#/s:Sy17RV.abstract: This returns an Array of indexes that map all the occurrences of a given substring.

Extensions/StringProtocol.html#/s:Sy17RV.name: ranges(of:options:)
Extensions/StringProtocol.html#/s:Sy17RV.abstract: This returns an Array of Index Ranges that map all the occurrences of a given substring.

Extensions/StringProtocol.html.name: StringProtocol
Extensions/StringProtocol.html.abstract: These are a variety of cool String extensions that add some great extra cheese on the pizza.

Extensions/RVS_BLEService.html.name: RVS_BLEService
Extensions/RVS_BLEService.html.abstract: This is the public face of the service structure.

Enums/RVS_BLEDriver_ValueProtocol_Type_E.name: stringValue(_:)
Enums/RVS_BLEDriver_ValueProtocol_Type_E.abstract: The data, cast to a String (associated value)

Enums/RVS_BLEDriver_ValueProtocol_Type_E.name: intValue(_:)
Enums/RVS_BLEDriver_ValueProtocol_Type_E.abstract: The data, cast to an Integer (associated value)

Enums/RVS_BLEDriver_ValueProtocol_Type_E.name: boolValue(_:)
Enums/RVS_BLEDriver_ValueProtocol_Type_E.abstract: The data, cast to a Boolean (associated value)

Enums/RVS_BLEDriver_ValueProtocol_Type_E.name: floatValue(_:)
Enums/RVS_BLEDriver_ValueProtocol_Type_E.abstract: The data, cast to a double-precision float (associated value)

Enums/RVS_BLEDriver_ValueProtocol_Type_E.name: rawValue(_:)
Enums/RVS_BLEDriver_ValueProtocol_Type_E.abstract: The data is not able to be cast, and is returned as the raw Data type.

Enums/RVS_BLEDriver_ValueProtocol_Type_E.name: undefinedValue
Enums/RVS_BLEDriver_ValueProtocol_Type_E.abstract: This is returned if the data is nil, or an undefined type (no associated value).

Enums/RVS_BLEDriver_ValueProtocol_Type_E.name: RVS_BLEDriver_ValueProtocol_Type_Enum
Enums/RVS_BLEDriver_ValueProtocol_Type_E.abstract: This enum is used to cast a value into its proper data type.

Classes/RVS_BLE_goTenna_Service/RVS_BLE_.name: goTennaProprietary
Classes/RVS_BLE_goTenna_Service/RVS_BLE_.abstract: This is the basic goTenna proprietary service.

Classes/RVS_BLE_goTenna_Service/RVS_BLE_.name: RVS_BLE_GATT_UUID
Classes/RVS_BLE_goTenna_Service/RVS_BLE_.abstract: These are String-based enums that we use to reference various services and characteristics in our driver.

Classes/RVS_BLE_DeviceInfo_Service/RVS_B.name: RVS_BLE_GATT_UUID
Classes/RVS_BLE_DeviceInfo_Service/RVS_B.abstract: These are String-based enums that we use to reference various services and characteristics in our driver.

Classes/RVS_BLEDriver/Errors.html#/s:17R.name: bluetoothNotAvailable
Classes/RVS_BLEDriver/Errors.html#/s:17R.abstract: This is returned if the manager can’t power on.

Classes/RVS_BLEDriver/Errors.html#/s:17R.name: connectionAttemptFailed(error:)
Classes/RVS_BLEDriver/Errors.html#/s:17R.abstract: This is returned if we cannot connect to the device.

Classes/RVS_BLEDriver/Errors.html#/s:17R.name: connectionAttemptFailedNoDevice
Classes/RVS_BLEDriver/Errors.html#/s:17R.abstract: This is returned if we connected, but no device was available. This should never happen.

Classes/RVS_BLEDriver/Errors.html#/s:17R.name: disconnectionAttemptFailed(error:)
Classes/RVS_BLEDriver/Errors.html#/s:17R.abstract: This is returned if we cannot disconnect from the device.

Classes/RVS_BLEDriver/Errors.html#/s:17R.name: unknownDisconnectionError
Classes/RVS_BLEDriver/Errors.html#/s:17R.abstract: This is a catchall error for a disconnection issue

Classes/RVS_BLEDriver/Errors.html#/s:17R.name: unknownPeripheralDiscoveryError(error:)
Classes/RVS_BLEDriver/Errors.html#/s:17R.abstract: This is a catchall error for peripheral discovery

Classes/RVS_BLEDriver/Errors.html#/s:17R.name: characteristicValueMissing
Classes/RVS_BLEDriver/Errors.html#/s:17R.abstract: This means that we did not get a characteristic value

Classes/RVS_BLEDriver/Errors.html#/s:17R.name: unknownCharacteristicsDiscoveryError(error:)
Classes/RVS_BLEDriver/Errors.html#/s:17R.abstract: This is a catchall error for characteristics discovery

Classes/RVS_BLEDriver/Errors.html#/s:17R.name: unknownCharacteristicsReadValueError(error:)
Classes/RVS_BLEDriver/Errors.html#/s:17R.abstract: This is a catchall error for characteristics value read

Classes/RVS_BLEDriver/Errors.html#/s:17R.name: localizedDescription
Classes/RVS_BLEDriver/Errors.html#/s:17R.abstract: The localized description is a simple slug that can be used to key a client-supplied message.

Classes/RVS_BLEDriver/Errors.html.name: Errors
Classes/RVS_BLEDriver/Errors.html.abstract: These are the various errors that can be returned by this class.

Classes/RVS_BLEDriver.html#/c:@CM@RVS_BL.name: devices
Classes/RVS_BLEDriver.html#/c:@CM@RVS_BL.abstract: This accesses the devices as a simple Array.

Classes/RVS_BLEDriver.html#/c:@CM@RVS_BL.name: stayConnected
Classes/RVS_BLEDriver.html#/c:@CM@RVS_BL.abstract: This is a flag that tells us to remain connected continuously, until explicitly disconnected by the user. Default is false.

Classes/RVS_BLEDevice.html#/s:17RVS_BLED.name: delegate
Classes/RVS_BLEDevice.html#/s:17RVS_BLED.abstract: This is our delegate instance. It can be nil. READ/WRITE

Classes/RVS_BLEDevice.html#/c:@CM@RVS_BL.name: isConnected
Classes/RVS_BLEDevice.html#/c:@CM@RVS_BL.abstract: This manages and reports our connection. Changing this value will connect or disconnect this device.

Classes/RVS_BLEDevice.html#/c:@CM@RVS_BL.name: shouldStayConnected
Classes/RVS_BLEDevice.html#/c:@CM@RVS_BL.abstract: This is a flag that tells us to remain connected continuously, until explicitly disconnected by the user. Default is false.

Classes/RVS_BLEDevice.html#/c:@CM@RVS_BL.name: manufacturerName
Classes/RVS_BLEDevice.html#/c:@CM@RVS_BL.abstract: This is the manufacturer name. It will be filled at initialization time.

Classes/RVS_BLEDevice.html#/c:@CM@RVS_BL.name: modelNumber
Classes/RVS_BLEDevice.html#/c:@CM@RVS_BL.abstract: This is the model number. It will be filled at initialization time.

Classes/RVS_BLEDevice.html#/c:@CM@RVS_BL.name: hardwareRevision
Classes/RVS_BLEDevice.html#/c:@CM@RVS_BL.abstract: This is the hardware revision. It will be filled at initialization time.

Classes/RVS_BLEDevice.html#/c:@CM@RVS_BL.name: firmwareRevision
Classes/RVS_BLEDevice.html#/c:@CM@RVS_BL.abstract: This is the firmware revision. It will be filled at initialization time.

Classes/RVS_BLEDevice.html#/c:@CM@RVS_BL.name: id
Classes/RVS_BLEDevice.html#/c:@CM@RVS_BL.abstract: This is the unique ID for the peripheral.

Classes/RVS_BLEDevice.html#/s:17RVS_BLED.name: deleteThisDevice()
Classes/RVS_BLEDevice.html#/s:17RVS_BLED.abstract: If you call this, the driver will delete the device, and it will be eligible for rediscovery.

Classes/RVS_BLEDevice.html#/s:17RVS_BLED.name: services
Classes/RVS_BLEDevice.html#/s:17RVS_BLED.abstract: The services are returned in semi-opaque fashion, so they can be used via the protocol mask.

Classes/RVS_BLEDevice.html.name: RVS_BLEDevice
Classes/RVS_BLEDevice.html.abstract: This class models a single discovered BLE device (in peripheral mode).

Classes.html#/s:17RVS_BLEDriver_iOS0A36_.name: RVS_BLEDevice_DeviceSpec_GeneralPurpose
Classes.html#/s:17RVS_BLEDriver_iOS0A36_.abstract: This is a general-purpose adapter. It provides some of the standard BLE services and characteristics.

Classes/RVS_BLEDriver.html.name: RVS_BLEDriver
Classes/RVS_BLEDriver.html.abstract: This class implements the main skeleton of the driver API.

Classes/RVS_BLE_DeviceInfo_Service.html.name: RVS_BLE_DeviceInfo_Service
Classes/RVS_BLE_DeviceInfo_Service.html.abstract: This class implements a BLE service wrapper, specialized for the Device Info standard service.

Classes/RVS_BLE_goTenna_Service.html.name: RVS_BLE_goTenna_Service
Classes/RVS_BLE_goTenna_Service.html.abstract: This class implements a BLE service wrapper, specialized for the goTenna Proprietary service.
